decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents: Existing Site Location Plan Dwg No 24-025-E00, Existing Site Block Plan Dwg No 24-025-E01, Existing Site Plan Dwg No 24-025-E02, Existing Ground Floor Plan Dwg No 24-025-E03, Existing First Floor Plan Dwg No 24-025-E04, Existing Loft Plan Dwg No 24-025-E05, Existing Roof Plan Dwg No 24-025-E06, Existing Front Elevation Dwg No 24-025-E07, Existing Rear Elevation Dwg No 24-025-E08, Existing Side Elevation Dwg No 24-025-E09, Proposed Site Block Plan Dwg No 24-025-P01, Proposed Site Plan Dwg No 24-025-P02, Proposed Ground Floor Plan Dwg No 24-025-P03, Proposed First Floor Plan Dwg No 24-025-P04, Proposed Roof Plan Dwg No 24-025-P06, Proposed Loft Plan Dwg No 24-025-P05, Proposed Front Elevation Dwg No 24-025-P07, Proposed Rear Elevation Dwg No 24-025-P08, Proposed Side Elevation Dwg No 24-025-P09 rev A, Design and Access Statement June 2024.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Cycle storage for ^IN;  bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| Other than the balconies identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2, no part of the roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the hereby permitted extension.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The hereby approved three (3) rooflights to the main front roof slope of shall not project more than 150mm from the plane of the roof slope when measured perpendicularly and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| The hereby approved privacy panels shall  be installed in accordance with the approved plans in condition 2 prior to occupation and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012).

| The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing configurations shall be based on environmental noise levels occurring during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). Internal and external amenity noise levels shall not exceed the criteria set by BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below/above and adjoining kitchen/dining/living room of separate flats, and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedrooms adjoining the communal main entrance and staircase to the upper flats. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Conversion of 2 self-contained residential units into 4 self-contained residential units with associated amenity space, cycle and refuse storage; part single-storey, part two-storey rear/side extension; alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension; rear roof terrace at first and second floor levels & installation of three rooflights to front roof slope [reconsultation]
